intro: Exacum rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, dark green leaves that are round or heart-shaped, giving it its common name. Its showy, tubular flowers come in a variety of colors, including white, pink, and purple, and bloom throughout the year in suitable conditions. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
